Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Statistics: monitor number of downloads processed per day" (#6070) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
If there is a massive drop in downloads processed, it may indicate there is something faulty in our statistics pipeline.

See https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6051

LINQ query:
```
var minDate = Fact_Downloads.Max(d => d.Dimension_Date_Id) - 30;
Fact_Downloads.Where(d => d.Dimension_Date_Id >= minDate).GroupBy(d => d.Dimension_Date_Id).Select(g => new { Date = g.Key, DownloadCount = g.Sum(d => d.DownloadCount) }).Dump();
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dotnet restore fails if NuGet package feed lacks <d:version> node in one of the entries" (#7026) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet Restore will fail with `System.NullReferenceException` if a feed about NuGet package contains an entry without `<d:version>` node in the <m:properties> node of the entry. 

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): dotnet.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 4.6.1.5019

dotnet.exe --version: 2.1.103

VS version (if appropriate): 15.6.4

OS version: win10 10.0.15063

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:
Started failing when entry with missing `<d:version>` appeared in NuGet feed.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

NuGet Restore will fail with System.NullReferenceException if a feed about NuGet package contains an entry without `<d:version>` node in the <m:properties> node of the entry. 

1. Have a remote feed with one of the entries missing `<d:version>` node. E.g. an entry of Foo package version v1 does not contain `<d:version>` in the feed.

2. Try to add some other version (Foo v2 which has `<d:version>2.0</d:version>` set) of the package from the feed the test project.

Fails to add the package to the test project. 

## Other suggested things
The issue is with [BuildModel ](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/76391da0b108dad7993e461eafcff8e857c6c2d3/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/RemoteRepositories/RemoteV2FindPackageByIdResource.cs#L450) method of `RemoteV2FindPackageByIdResource.cs`. BuildModel method does not account for missing version xml node and throws an exception. However the consumer of BuildModel method ([FindPackagesByIdAsyncCore](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/76391da0b108dad7993e461eafcff8e857c6c2d3/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/RemoteRepositories/RemoteV2FindPackageByIdResource.cs#L395)) is expecting null values and filters those.

I would suggest to change BuildModel to return null if version xml node was not found in an entry.

### Verbose Logs
```
NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.FatalProtocolException: Failed to retrieve information about 'Swashbuckle.AspNetCore' from remote source 'https://localsource/nuget/Default/FindPackagesById()?id='Swashbuckle.AspNetCore''. ---> System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at NuGet.Protocol.RemoteV2FindPackageByIdResource.BuildModel(String id, XElement element)
   at NuGet.Protocol.RemoteV2FindPackageByIdResource.<>c__DisplayClass22_0.<FindPackagesByIdAsyncCore>b__2(XElement x)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.SelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereEnumerableIterator`1.MoveNext()
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1.AddEnumerable(IEnumerable`1 enumerable)
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1.InsertRange(Int32 index, IEnumerable`1 collection)
   at NuGet.Protocol.RemoteV2FindPackageByIdResource.<>c__DisplayClass22_2.<<FindPackagesByIdAsyncCore>b__0>d.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
```

### Sample Project
One could modify the unit test source xml to reproduce the issue.
Add to NuGet.Client\test\NuGet.Core.Tests\NuGet.Protocol.Tests\compiler\resources\XunitFindPackagesById.xml an entry with `<d:version>` node missing. E.g. place the below entry before `</feed>` node:
```
  <entry>
    <id>https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/Packages(Id='xunit',Version='2.1.0--rc1')</id>
    <category term="NuGetGallery.OData.V2FeedPackage" scheme="http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices/scheme" />
    <link rel="edit" href="https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/Packages(Id='xunit',Version='2.1.0--rc1')" />
    <link rel="self" href="https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/Packages(Id='xunit',Version='2.1.0--rc1')" />
    <title type="text">xunit</title>
    <updated>2015-10-09T16:10:26Z</updated>
    <author>
      <name>James Newkirk, Brad Wilson</name>
    </author>
    <content type="application/zip" src="https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/xunit/2.1.0--rc1" />
    <m:properties>
      <d:Id>xunit</d:Id>
      <!--<d:Version>2.1.0</d:Version> Version node is missing. -->
      <d:NormalizedVersion>2.1.0--rc1</d:NormalizedVersion>
      <d:Authors>James Newkirk, Brad Wilson</d:Authors>
      <d:Copyright m:null="true" />
      <d:Created m:type="Edm.DateTime">2015-09-27T18:29:32.007</d:Created>
      <d:Dependencies>xunit.core:[2.1.0--rc1]:|xunit.assert:[2.1.0--rc1]:</d:Dependencies>
      <d:Description>
        xUnit.net is a developer testing framework, built to support Test Driven Development, with a design goal of extreme simplicity and alignment with framework features.

        Installing this package installs xunit.core and xunit.assert.
      </d:Description>
      <d:DownloadCount m:type="Edm.Int32">1592239</d:DownloadCount>
      <d:GalleryDetailsUrl>https://www.nuget.org/packages/xunit/2.1.0--rc1</d:GalleryDetailsUrl>
      <d:IconUrl>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xunit/media/master/logo-512-transparent.png</d:IconUrl>
      <d:IsLatestVersion m:type="Edm.Boolean">true</d:IsLatestVersion>
      <d:IsAbsoluteLatestVersion m:type="Edm.Boolean">false</d:IsAbsoluteLatestVersion>
      <d:IsPrerelease m:type="Edm.Boolean">false</d:IsPrerelease>
      <d:Language>en-US</d:Language>
      <d:LastUpdated m:type="Edm.DateTime">2015-10-09T16:10:26.483</d:LastUpdated>
      <d:Published m:type="Edm.DateTime">2015-09-27T18:29:32.007</d:Published>
      <d:PackageHash>u/7VQSOSXa7kSG4iK6Lcn7RqKZQ3hk7cnyMNVMpXHSP0RI5VQEtc44hvkG3LyWOVsx1dhUDD3rPAHAxyOUDQJw==</d:PackageHash>
      <d:PackageHashAlgorithm>SHA512</d:PackageHashAlgorithm>
      <d:PackageSize m:type="Edm.Int64">2986</d:PackageSize>
      <d:ProjectUrl>https://github.com/xunit/xunit</d:ProjectUrl>
      <d:ReportAbuseUrl>https://www.nuget.org/package/ReportAbuse/xunit/2.1.0--rc1</d:ReportAbuseUrl>
      <d:ReleaseNotes m:null="true" />
      <d:RequireLicenseAcceptance m:type="Edm.Boolean">false</d:RequireLicenseAcceptance>
      <d:Summary m:null="true" />
      <d:Tags m:null="true" />
      <d:Title>xUnit.net</d:Title>
      <d:VersionDownloadCount m:type="Edm.Int32">212201</d:VersionDownloadCount>
      <d:MinClientVersion>2.8.5</d:MinClientVersion>
      <d:LastEdited m:null="true" />
      <d:LicenseUrl>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xunit/xunit/master/license.txt</d:LicenseUrl>
      <d:LicenseNames m:null="true" />
      <d:LicenseReportUrl m:null="true" />
    </m:properties>
  </entry>
```
Run unit tests. 
**Expected result**: all tests passing
**Actual result**: `GetAllVersionsAsync_ReturnsAllVersionsAsync` fails with `System.NullReferenceException`:
```
NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.FatalProtocolException : Failed to retrieve information about 'xunit' from remote source 'http://6c3dcd8c-5200-44e0-80f6-e10f860900f8/FindPackagesById()?id='xunit'&semVerLevel=2.0.0'.
---- System.NullReferenceException : Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at NuGet.Protocol.RemoteV2FindPackageByIdResource.<FindPackagesByIdAsyncCore>d__23.MoveNext() in C:\github\NuGet.Client\src\NuGet.Core\NuGet.Protocol\RemoteRepositories\RemoteV2FindPackageByIdResource.cs:line 443
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Running executable from a NuGet package with PackageReference management format" (#5975) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a code base and two project files that target two versions of the .NET framework. Since I have them stored in the same folder I cannot rely on a `Packages.config` file since it will always incorporate one framework version and not the other. Thus I moved to `PackageReference` which worked great so far.

Unfortunately I just installed `Mono.TextTemplating` and wanted to execute the provided `TextTransform.exe` as a pre-build event on all of my `*.tt` files however I cannot reference it properly since it is stored under `%userprofile%\.nuget\packages\mono.texttemplating\1.3.1\`. The moment I update the package and forget about it, it will break since the new version will be stored under a different folder. Similiar to any changes of the local package storage.

How am I supposed to include executables from NuGet packages into my build steps now?

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS UI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 4.3

VS version (if appropriate): Enterprise 2017 (15.3.5)

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Windows 10 v1703 (15063.608)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Augment PackageReference with InstallPath metadata" (#4064) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Some packages may need to consume tools provided by other packages. One concrete example: ilmerge (the nuget package). That package provides the ILMerge.exe tool, but no MSBuild target to expose its location for other nuget packages to consume (or the project itself).

To avoid hardcoding versions (i.e. `$(NuGetPackageRoot)ILMerge\2.14.1208\tools\ILMerge.exe`) when invoking the tool, it would be great if the NuGet targets automatically augmented the `PackageReferece` with the determined version's install path, so that a consuming project could do, for example:

```
<ItemGroup>
    <ILMergeReference Include="%(PackageReference)" Condition="'%(Identity)' == 'ilmerge'" />
</ItemGroup>
<PropertyGroup>
    <ILMergePath>%(ILMergeReference.InstallPath)\tools</ILMergePath>
</PropertyGroup>
```

This mechanism may be useful for referencing other package's assets too, like samples, docs, etc.

Granted, this isn't impossible to solve today, by just modifying the package providing the tools so that it exposes a property for its own current location (i.e. ILMergePath property in an ilmerge.props), but this mechanism would make all package assets available reliably for anyone regardless of how well authored the package is.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Improve error/warning code logging in nuget" (#7028) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In our current design, the default error handling path doesn't handle exception with error code properly.
every time we want to show some error/warning code, we have to catch the specified exception and call some logMessage service to show the error/warning code properly.

Ideally, we should automatically show error/warning code if the exception have one. We have tons of exception like PackagingException, ProtocolException don't show error/warning code.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Understand the additional scenarios with the new plugin" (#6956) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Part of https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6923. 

The goal here is to understand if there are any additional scenarios that the current plugin architecture does not support.
 
An example of such scenario is the proxy https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6923, which was discussed in earlier meeting.

Some items that need addressed
- Log message when the plugin is not interactive and the creds cannot be accessed
- Set the log level before initiating communication to the plugin.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet new -i, on two private feeds, unauthorized" (#7027) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @maracuja-juice on May 28, 2018 12:16_

I have a Template package that I published to a private feed. (let's name it "Nutshell")
I deleted this package from the "Nutshell" NuGet feed and uploaded it to a different private feed, with a newer version. (let's name that one: "Peach", "Nutshell" will get obsolete at some point)
The feeds are both hosted in VSTS.

I created a PAT with the permission of "packaging (read)" and added it to my NuGet config:
```
  <packageSourceCredentials>
    <packageSourceKey>
      <add key="Username" value="myVSTSUserNAme" />
      <add key="ClearTextPassword" value="myToken" />
    </packageSourceKey>
  </packageSourceCredentials>
```

Now when I try to install the package via `dotnet new -i` I always get the error:

```
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.200\NuGet.targets(114,5): error : Unable to load the service index for source https://nutshell.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/nutshell/nuget/v3/index.json. [C:\Users\maracujajuice\.templateengine\dotnetcli\v2.1.200\scratch\restore.csproj]
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.200\NuGet.targets(114,5): error :   Response status code does not indicate success: 401 (Unauthorized). [C:\Users\maracujajuice\.templateengine\dotnetcli\v2.1.200\scratch\restore.csproj]
```

As you can see: It tries to get the package from the "Nutshell" feed (package is deleted in version 1.0) but it should get it from the "Peach" feed where the package is in version 1.2.
If I explicitly state the version (`Template.Package.Name::1.2.0`) it gets the package correctly from the "Peach" feed.
Why does it want to get it from the "Nutshell" feed by default / doesn't try out both as the same package is on both feeds? (once deleted though)
Can you reproduce this problem?

Thanks for your help. 

_Copied from original issue: dotnet/templating#1545_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Test Failure][Accessibility][DEU][PLK][CSY] ’Top-Level’ column name on ‘Migrate NuGet format to PackageReference’ dialog truncated" (#7025) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client release-4.8.0-preview3-4.8.0.5275
VS Version: D15.8 27813.00
OS Version: Windows 10 rs3_release_svc_escrow.180502-1908 DEU/ITA/PLK/CSY

## Detailed repro steps
1.	Launch VS and click menu Tools->NuGet Package Manager->Package Manager Settings.
2.	Check ‘Allow format selection on first package install’ format.
3.	Create a new C# Console App (.NET Framework) via VS and click ‘Manage NuGet Packages…’
4.	Select a package in ‘Browse’ tab and click Install button.
5.	Select ‘Packages.config’ format and click OK button.
6.	Right-Click the “References” node and select the “Migrate packages.config to PackageReference…”
7.	Check the ’Top-Level’ column name on ‘Migrate NuGet format to PackageReference’ dialog.

## Expected
’Top-Level’ column name show correctly.

## Actual
’Top-Level’ column name on ‘Migrate NuGet format to PackageReference’ dialog truncated as below screenshot.
![columnnametruncatedonplk](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/41405900-762a9dc6-6fba-11e8-96f4-d99e51bb8486.PNG)

## Note
1.	Verifying on FRA and RUS are blocked by bug https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7021.
2.	Repro on DEU/ITA/PLK/CSY.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.org API rate limits for package updates" (#24) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
|Spec wiki|Discussion issue|
|----------|------------------|
|*None*|https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4679|

We have been working on improving the package submission workflow to reduce the overall time it takes to publish the package (right from package push/upload) till it's available for consumption and search. 

As mentioned on our [blog post](https://blog.nuget.org/20180201/NuGet-package-publishing-workflow-behind-the-scenes.html), the package availability gets degraded multi fold whenever there is a large number package uploads/updates by a single owner that clogs the package submission pipeline. Until we are able to scale to handle the large submission rate, in the short-term, we plan to reduce the rate limits for package pushes or deletes (unlist) per user.

The current [documented rate limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/api/rate-limits#package-push-and-unlist) will be updated to the following new limits once implemented. This change will go live, **soon** (within a week or two):

## Package Push and Unlist

| API | Limit Type | Limit Value | API usecase | 
|:---|:---|:---|:--- |
**PUT** `/api/v2/package` | API Key | ~~100 / minute~~ **250 / hour** | Upload a new NuGet package (version) via v2 push endpoint 
**DELETE** `/api/v2/package/{id}/{version}` | API Key | ~~100 / minute~~ **50 / hour** | Unlist a NuGet package (version) via v2 endpoint
